page.title: 02Temple Newsam House
page.content: Five minutes mini bus drive from Cross Gates Middle is Temple Newsam House which was built on an estate once owned by the Knights Templars. Although the building of the House began around 1500 AD, buildings were recorded in the Domesday Book of 1086:Neu husu('at the new houses') and that is how the name Temple Newsam came about. In 1545 Lord Darnley, who later married Mary Queen of Scots, was born in the house. Today Temple Newsam belongs to the city of Leeds and is part of the City Art Galleries. It is a large impressive estate , a beautiful Elizabeth House with lawns sloping down to two lakes nestling in shaded woodland. A nature trail is very carefully marked and the really interested walker can have a guided tour of the woods and glades that are
